pageContext.claim: “We had a great meeting. Very, very great meeting. I mean, I think you could have lost 50 million people more. If you think that Seoul is 28 million people that is right on the border. You know, people say hundreds of thousands, not hundreds of thousand. We are talking about 50, 60, 100 million people could have been wiped out and lost.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump exaggerates the number of potential casualties and exaggerates his accomplishments by saying he's very close to solving the situation. According to the Congressional Research Service, “an escalation of a military conflict on the peninsula could affect upwards of 25 million people on either side of the border.”
